place.name: ELMBRIDGE
place.gazetteerText: ELMBRIDGE, a chapelry in Dodderhill parish, Worcester; near the Oxford and Wolverhampton railway, 3¾ miles SW of Hartlebury Junction r. station, and 3¾ N of Droitwich. Post town, Droitwich. Real property, £3, 078. Pop., 391. Houses, 101. The property is much subdivided. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Dodderhill, in the diocese of Worcester. The church is ancient but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
